artist: Artist: Suzuki Harunobu; Author: Komatsuya Hyakki; Publisher: Nishimuraya Yohachi
description: woman partially seated on a white horse, wearing a red plaid kimono and a wide-brimmed hat, engaged in intercourse with a standing man wearing green knee-high socks; tiny man smoking a pipe seated beneath a tree in LRC; text in URC in a cloud; three areas of text at bottom on grey path
inscription:
in cloud: 湯治そふおふして　それより江戸へおもむく道すがら　さま／＼のいちやつきを見て心をなくさむ {Toji so o shite, sore yori Edo e omomuku michi sugara samazama no ichatsuki wo mite kokoro wo nagusamu}
in image: 「ても是は大ののめり道具　与作にはむかぬつらだ」 {Temo kore wa dai no nomeri dogu. Yosaku ni wa mukanu tsura da.}; 「そりやはいるは　山がらのゑおとしとりとは此事だ」 {Sorya hairu wa. Yamagara no eotoshi tori towa konokoto da.}; 「舟の来るまではまだあいだかある」 {Fune no kuru made wa mada aida ga aru.}; 「モヲ駄ちんもなんにもいりませぬ　熊谷の土手打こしにのせませう」 {Mou dachin mo nan nimo irimasenu. Kumagaya no dote uchi koshi ni nosemasho.}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Elegant Erotic Mane'emon (Fūryū enshoku Mane'emon 風流艶色真似ゑもん)
text: The gait of her trotting horse has put a travelling beauty into the mood so she seduces the horse driver while waiting for a ferry; the enthusiastic attendant waives his fee and offers to take her two stops further to the Kumagaya embankment on the Arakawa River.
title: From Ikaho to Edo, No. 9 from the book Elegant Erotic Mane'emon (Fūryū enshoku Mane'emon), vol. 1
